conclusion: Identify the system and forces acting on the blocks.
Four identical wooden blocks: A, B, C, and D; B and C connected by a light spring; force F applied to B; smooth surface.
Determine the acceleration of the system using Newton's second law.
Analyze forces on block D; it accelerates with a.
Block D has no friction with the surface; only horizontal force is static friction from block C.
Static friction force f_s must provide necessary force for block D's acceleration.
Calculate static friction force: f_s = ma = F / 4.
Conclusion: Static friction force on block D is F / 4.
